fr.ecp.IS1220.myVelib.core

Class MyVelibNetwork

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.ecp.IS1220.myVelib.core.MyVelibNetwork

  • public class MyVelibNetwork
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a MyVelib network. It is a singleton.
    Author:
    Valentin

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static MyVelibNetwork getInstance()
                                  throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        This method should be used when trying to access the MyVelib network. If the network has not been instantiated, throws a RuntimeException.
        Returns:
        the unique instance of MyVelibNetwork
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - occurs when there is no instance of the network

      • createEmptyStation

        public void createEmptyStation(Localization localization,
                               java.lang.Boolean isPlus,
                               int numberOfSlots)
        Add a new empty station with a number of slots to the network.
        Parameters:
        localization - localization of the station
        isPlus - type of station (true for Plus, false for Standard)
        numberOfSlots - number of parking slots

      • createPopStation

        public void createPopStation(Localization localization,
                             java.lang.Boolean isPlus,
                             int numberOfSlots,
                             int[] numberOfBicycles)
        Adds a new station with a number of slots to the network. This station is populated with the number of bicycles specified, one number for each type. The numbers of bicycles of each type should be listed in an array giving the number of bicycles for each type in order of appearance in the bicycle type dictionary (see Bicycle.getTypeDict()).
        Parameters:
        localization - localization of the station
        isPlus - type of station (true for Plus, false for Standard)
        numberOfSlots - number of parking slots
        numberOfBicycles - number of bicycles of each type

      • createStations

        public void createStations(Localization center,
                           double radius,
                           int number,
                           int plusNumber,
                           int numberOfSlots,
                           double populationPercentage,
                           double[] typePercentage)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method creates a number of stations within a circular perimeter defined by a center and a radius. The stations contain a number of parking slots, which can be populated with bicycles.
        Parameters:
        center - center of the covered area
        radius - radius of the covered area (in km)
        number - number of stations
        plusNumber - number of Plus stations
        numberOfSlots - number of parking slots in each station
        populationPercentage - percentage of parking slots which should be populated with bicycles
        typePercentage - portion of each type of bicycle relatively to the total amount of bicycles
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - occurs when a wrong type of parameter is passed to the method
